result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M. Gehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State appears by Matthew Allen.  Atty Kyle Reimann appears with Brian Gehn, who is in custody.    State recites joint recommendation: Sentence withheld and placed on 3 years probation with conditions.  AODA assessment and followup; absolute sobriety and no use/possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription; take prescribed meds as prescribed and comply with any court-ordered treatment; random UA;s /PBT's at discretion of agent; any other evaluations/counseling/programming as recommended by DOC.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

State appears by Matthew Allen.  Atty Kyle Reimann appears with Brian Gehn, who is in custody.    State recites joint recommendation: Sentence withheld and placed on 3 years probation with conditions.  AODA assessment and followup; absolute sobriety and no use/possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription; take prescribed meds as prescribed and comply with any court-ordered treatment; random UA;s /PBT's at discretion of agent; any other evaluations/counseling/programming as recommended by DOC.  Restitution of $32.00 to Crappie Shop and no contact with Crappie Shop; Court costs of $443.00 plus $20.00 crime prevention surcharge . Defendant remanded to Iowa Co. Jail.183 Days Credit if revoked.

ADA Matt Allen appears for State.  Kyle Riemann appears as stand-by counsel for defendant by phone.  No appearance by Brian Gehn.  Court addresses question regarding competency.  Will be addressed on Thursday. Atty Riemann will call in.
Status conference on February 22, 2019 at 01:00 pm.

11:56 AM Defendant Brian M. Gehn in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reimann present as stand-by guardian.  Request to modify bond to signature bond as defendant is incarcerated on cash bond.  Defendant gives arugment in favor of signature bond.  State objects to request for modification and gives basis, including extradition proceedings and multiple bail jumping charges.  Court denies request to modify bond - cash bond previously set will remain.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2019 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Kyle Reimann appointed by Judge Koehler as a "stand-by attorney" for defendant in the event  the defendant needs assistance.  Mr. Reimann is available to appear on 1/16/2019.
Bail/Bond Review on January 3, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 16, 2019 at 11:30 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Brian M. Gehn in court with attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson.  Defendant Brian M. Gehn in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency report has been received and reviewed by parties.  Defendant did not want to review report but Atty Erickson did inform him of the findings.  DA Nelson waives request for evidentuary hearing.  Defendant does not challenge findings of report but requests evidentuary hearing.  Court finds defendant has waived evidentuary hearing based on his declaration that he is competent to stand trial.  Court will issue cases back on criminal court track.  Defendant has requested withdrawal of Atty Erickson and makes request to represent himself.   Court advises defendant of prior ruling in regards to representation and recites rights to representation. Court further advises this is the last opportunity for representation.  Defendant advises he wishes Atty Erickson be allowed to withdraw.  Court grants requests and allows Atty Erickson to withdraw. Court grants requests and allows Atty Erickson to withdraw. RTAW - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to attorney and advised to contact the District Attorney's office.  Status conference scheduled for January 16, 2019 at 11:30 am.

in Support of Motion for Order Authorizing Attorney Conference
for Order Authorizing Attorney Conference

Defendant Brian M. Gehn in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3 cases called - 15CM220; 16CF73; 18CF76.    RTAW - colloquy given.   Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant in all cases.  Court qustions defendant, he feels he is competent to make this decision as to waiver of counsel; he will negotiate some cases, and take some to jury.  Colloquy continues regarding acting as his own attorney.  Court finds that Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably, competently and intelligently waives right to attorney and advised to contact the District Attorney's office.    Court hears ADA Allen.  Remanded.

Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court, defendant Brian M. Gehn not in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank reports defendant is competent, based on report, and requests a hearing on competency.  Defendant is not contesting finding of examiner.  The Court determines compentency was already determined.  Atty Frank will be filing motion(s) in 16CF73 and will look at 15CM220.  Atty Frank requests 30 days to file motions - by 03/02/2018.  Response by 03/23/2018.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 12, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw as Counsel
Status conference on December 4, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian M. Gehn in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Defendant Brian M. Gehn in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency report has been filed and parties have received copies.  Defendant stated he does not think he has seen the report.  Court will address Atty Angel's motion to withdraw.  Atty Angel advises Court of conflicts and feels those conflicts cannot be resolved.  Defendant advises he thinks his release date is 11/10/2017, but he is not sure.  The State is not opposed to withdrawal of counsel and advises there is not a adversary affect on the State's case if there is further delay.  Court gives findings and will grant motion to withdraw.  SPD will need to appoint another attorney.
Competency issue:  Court finds good cause to waive time limits for hearing based on non-representation.  Court will set hearing based on likely length of time for appointment.  If an attorney is appointed by next hearing, defendant's appearance could be excused.  If not, defendant will need to be present.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference on June 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brian M. Gehn in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Defendant Brian M. Gehn in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Angel addresses the Court - defendant has asked to represent himself.  There was resolution to these matters, but due to the defendant's request, Atty Angel  is requesting withdrawal.  Court will allow withdrawal on this case, request for a RTAW.  Atty Angel will assist the defendant in filling out that form.    Further discussion - defendant wants to keep Atty Angel in felony matter.  Atty Angel brings up possible competency concern.  Defendant refuses competency evaluation but due to concern of counsel a waiver of attorney will not be accepted, Atty Angel will prepare and submit an order for competency evaluation and this hearing will be reset.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
